image.alt: Patients and team smiling at Eagan Orthodontics office

paragraphs.text: Welcome to Eagan Orthodontics, P.C.! Thank you for visiting the website of a third‑generation orthodontic practice creating beautiful, confident smiles throughout the metropolitan Detroit area since 1955. Our dedicated team of highly qualified professionals works to determine the treatment solution best suited to your unique needs.

Dr. J. Victor Eagan and Dr. Javen Durham offer a wide variety of modern orthodontic options and use the latest advancements in care. We focus on comfortable experiences, clear communication, and results that fit your lifestyle.

items.title: Third-Generation Practice
items.text: Creating beautiful smiles since 1955, our long family history gives patients confidence in experienced, community-rooted care.

items.text: In-house financing and patient-first payment options make treatment affordable and simple to manage.

items.title: Family-Focused Care
items.text: A family serving families approach, with care designed for children, teens, and adults and community events like Deband Day.

paragraphs.text: Dr. J. Victor Eagan trained at the University of Michigan and Howard University School of Dentistry. A leader in orthodontics and part of the Eagan legacy, he brings decades of experience and state-of-the-art care to every patient, focusing on both function and confident appearance.

paragraphs.text: Dr. Javen Durham completed his DDS at Meharry Medical College and orthodontic specialty training at Howard University. As the first third‑generation orthodontist in the Eagan family tradition, he brings fresh energy and advanced specialty training to patient care.

og_meta.title: Eagan Orthodontics, P.C. — Creating Confident Smiles Since 1955
og_meta.description: Third‑generation orthodontic care offering Damon braces, clear aligners, retainers and patient-first financing in metropolitan Detroit.

image.alt: Team of orthodontic professionals smiling in the Lakeshore Orthodontics office lobby

paragraphs.text: Thank you for visiting Eagan Orthodontics, a third‑generational orthodontic practice creating beautiful, confident smiles since 1955. Our dedicated team of highly‑qualified professionals is committed to determining which treatment solution is best suited for your specific orthodontic needs to deliver the ideal result.

Dr. J. Victor Eagan and Dr. Javen Durham offer a wide variety of innovative treatment options and use the latest orthodontic advancements to deliver predictable, comfortable care for children, teens, and adults.
We pride ourselves on combining clinical excellence with a warm, family-centered approach that makes every patient feel respected and informed throughout treatment.

From flexible scheduling to digital technology and multiple treatment options, we strive to make orthodontic care accessible and convenient so patients can confidently share their new smiles with the world.

For Dr. J. Victor Eagan, orthodontics wasn't just an interest, it was in his blood. He began working in his father's office at age 10 and built a long career dedicated to creating healthy, confident smiles.

Dr. Eagan practices with state-of-the-art equipment and a long record of clinical excellence. He has served as an international speaker and author and has been widely recognized for his contributions to the profession.

image.alt: Dr. J. Victor Eagan in office

paragraphs.text: Dr. Eagan completed his undergraduate training and D.D.S. with honors at the University of Michigan, then practiced general dentistry for eight years before pursuing specialty training in orthodontics.
He earned his orthodontic specialty training at Howard University School of Dentistry, graduating as valedictorian.
Outside the office Dr. Eagan serves as an ordained minister, continues to write and speak internationally, and manages several related business ventures with his wife, Catherine.
He splits his time between Orchard Lake, Michigan and Boca Raton, Florida, and remains deeply involved in community and professional organizations.
Dr. Javen Durham grew up working summers at Eagan Orthodontics and brings that lifelong connection to patient care into his professional practice.
He continues the Eagan family legacy of orthodontic excellence and works with patients of all ages to deliver individualized treatment plans.

Dr. Durham earned his undergraduate degree in Applied Physiology and Kinesiology from the University of Florida, his D.D.S. from Meharry Medical College School of Dentistry, and completed advanced specialty training in orthodontics at Howard University School of Dentistry in May 2022.
His training continues the family tradition of advanced orthodontic education at Howard University.
Dr. Durham is noted as the first third‑generation African‑American orthodontist in the world and enjoys outdoor activities, travel, and adventurous pastimes outside the office.

items.name: Vicki
items.bio: Executive Assistant who joined Eagan Orthodontics in 2009. She supports Dr. Eagan with administrative tasks and keeps the practice running smoothly while balancing family life and hobbies.

items.name: Gary
items.bio: Provides pastoral and pastoral-support services in the office, contributing to the practice atmosphere and offering intercessory prayer and emotional support to patients and staff.

items.name: Office Team
items.bio: A skilled, friendly team of clinicians and coordinators who support patients through every phase of treatment, from initial consult to retention.

slides.alt: Office common area and patient seating

paragraphs.text: Dr. Eagan and the practice are active in many local civic and community organizations. The practice’s history as a multi‑generational office and the doctors’ community honors reflect long‑standing involvement and service.

Event highlights include celebrations like Deband Day, when patients have braces removed and the office hosts a small party. The practice also participates in local awards and community recognition events.

image.alt: Graphic representing community support by Lakeshore Orthodontics

og_meta.title: About | Eagan Orthodontics
og_meta.description: Learn about Eagan Orthodontics, a third‑generation practice delivering personalized orthodontic care with experienced doctors and a dedicated team.

image.alt: Welcoming orthodontic team greeting a family in a bright modern office, patient-first environment

paragraphs.text: Your first visit is complimentary and includes a thorough orthodontic examination and discussion of potential treatment options. If indicated, we may reserve time after the exam for diagnostic records such as X-rays, intraoral photos, and impressions for study models; that additional visit can take approximately one hour.

During the initial exam the doctor will evaluate whether orthodontics can help, whether treatment is needed now or should be delayed, which procedures may be used, whether any permanent teeth should be removed, estimated treatment length, cost, and available payment options. To help us estimate benefits, please bring any panoramic X-ray taken within the past six months and your orthodontic insurance card if applicable.

image.alt: Orthodontist consulting with a patient about braces in a modern treatment room

paragraphs.text: We offer a variety of payment options and financing plans to fit your budget, including in-house financing when appropriate. Our team will review choices with you and explain them thoroughly so you understand your options.

Insurance: if your policy includes orthodontic benefits you will receive reduced personal costs. Many plans have a lifetime orthodontic benefit separate from regular dental coverage; policies vary, so we will review your insurance and file claims on your behalf once treatment begins.

The initial consultation and first visit are complimentary. If you have questions about financing or need help selecting a payment plan, ask our treatment coordinator and we will work to accommodate your needs.
We use online forms to make your first visit faster and more secure. Please complete the appropriate new patient information before your appointment so we can provide safe, personalized care.

Online forms: Child New Patient Information and Adult New Patient Information (the adult form includes a full medical and dental history). The practice uses web forms rather than exposed PDF downloads on the public site.

image.alt: Patient completing new patient information on a tablet in a bright orthodontic office
Family enjoying time together before orthodontic treatment

og_meta.title: Get Started | Eagan Orthodontics
og_meta.description: Start your journey with a complimentary consultation at Eagan Orthodontics. Learn what to expect at your first visit, access new patient forms, and schedule an

paragraphs.text: The American Association of Orthodontists recommends a screening around age 7. Early evaluation lets us watch growth and start treatment when it will be most effective.
An initial check at about age 7 helps us spot jaw or tooth problems early. We often monitor growth and only begin treatment when it will guide development best.

image.alt: Example of crossbite in a young patient

paragraphs.text: Early treatment can address severe crossbite, significant crowding, protruding front teeth, abnormal jaw growth, and habits like thumb sucking or tongue thrusting.
Starting early can shorten or simplify later treatment, reduce the chance of surgery, protect front teeth from injury, and guide jaw development for better long term results.

image.alt: Thumb sucking habit example and its effects

paragraphs.text: There is no upper age limit for orthodontic treatment. Healthy teeth can be moved at any age, though planning must consider gum health and existing dental work.
Many adults choose discreet options that fit work and social life while improving alignment, bite function, and confidence.
Braces use brackets bonded to teeth and an archwire that applies gentle, continuous force to move teeth into place. Options include traditional metal and tooth colored ceramic brackets.
Active treatment commonly ranges from about 6 to 30 months depending on complexity. Most patients visit every 5 to 10 weeks for adjustments.

Expect bracket placement, periodic wire changes or adjustments, possible use of elastics or auxiliary appliances, temporary soreness after visits, and careful oral hygiene. Retainers are fitted after active treatment.
Some systems, such as self ligating brackets, aim to reduce friction and may shorten adjustment time for certain cases.
Clear aligner treatment uses a planned series of removable, transparent trays that move teeth incrementally. Trays are typically changed about every two weeks and are planned with digital software.
Many teens and adults with mild to moderate alignment issues are candidates. Good compliance, wearing aligners about 22 hours per day, is essential for success.
Jaw surgery may be needed for major skeletal problems that affect chewing, speech, breathing, or severe bite discrepancies that cannot be corrected with orthodontics alone.
We use computerized planning and digital imaging to coordinate pre surgical and post surgical orthodontics with oral and maxillofacial surgeons for predictable function and aesthetic outcomes.
Retainers maintain your new smile. Options include Hawley retainers with acrylic and wire, clear aligner style retainers, and fixed bonded retainers for higher relapse risk.
Wear typically moves from full time for several months to night only, then occasional nights as directed. Lifelong night wear may be recommended for some patients.
We use digital imaging, radiographs, photographic records, study models, and computerized treatment planning to improve precision and predictability across treatments and surgical cases.
Clear aligner therapy and surgical planning are designed with specialized software so you can see a virtual plan of expected movements before treatment begins.
High quality X rays and intraoral photos help us diagnose and plan efficient treatment while minimizing radiation when possible.

image.alt: Family enjoying time together before orthodontic treatment

image.alt: Bright orthodontic office background with welcoming reception and modern decor

paragraphs.text: Find clear answers to common questions about treatment options, scheduling, insurance and home care so you can feel confident before your first visit.

We offer a range of treatments including traditional metal braces, clear ceramic braces, the Damon® self-ligating system, lingual braces, and clear aligner options. Your initial exam will cover recommended procedures, expected treatment length, and whether extractions or additional appliances are needed.

image.alt: Close-up of Damon bracket on tooth demonstrating self-ligating orthodontic hardware

paragraphs.text: Bring your orthodontic insurance card to your first visit so we can estimate benefits and submission requirements. Our team will review coverage, explain estimated patient responsibility, and discuss flexible monthly payment options when available.

image.alt: Clear ceramic braces on teeth to illustrate discreet orthodontic options

paragraphs.text: Most patients in braces are seen every 5–10 weeks for adjustments. We offer a complimentary initial exam and may take diagnostic records at that visit. For new or virtual screenings you can use the practice’s online Start Now virtual appointment: https://www.orthoscreening.com/screening/start?code=895JE5&sid=mljjr8eb-be444045-5917-awc6zmjgn&puid=be444045-5917-4fbd-8f22-88dd8ca5174f&step=0. For general appointment requests, use the contact form on the site.

image.alt: Modern orthodontic clinic reception area ready to welcome new patients

paragraphs.text: Protect your treatment by avoiding hard, crunchy or sticky foods like ice, hard candy, raw hard vegetables, caramel and taffy. Brush after meals and at bedtime, floss daily (use floss threaders if needed), and follow instructions for rinses or special products. After treatment, retainers (Hawley, clear aligner-type, or fixed bonded retainers) are used to maintain your smile; follow wearing and cleaning guidance to avoid damage.

image.alt: Three types of orthodontic retainers displayed: Hawley, clear aligner-style, and fixed lingual bonded retainer
Family enjoying time together before orthodontic treatment
